contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: accúḷ is an act of producing words and alphabets by moving writing instruments. On the other hand, horúḷ focuses more on writing as a means of recording information, having the connotation of somewhat long, coherent writing.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: What accúḷ takes in the accusative is what gets created as the result of writing (ex. alphabets).

contents.title: usage
contents.text: must be followed by a noun

translations.title: postposition
forms: with (in the sense of "in the company of")

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: There isn't difference between bhán and cájau when denoting "with" (in the sense of "in the company of"), though cájau tends to be preferred. "through" can only be expressed with bhán.

translations.title: stative verb
forms: to have the ability to speak [accusative] (language)

translations.title: postposition
forms: with (in the sense of "in the company of")

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Cannot be used in the sense of "by means of", for which the instrumental case is used.

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: There isn't difference between bhán and cájau when denoting "with" (in the sense of "in the company of"), though cájau tends to be preferred. "through" can only be expressed with bhán.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Appended after the verb to denote that the speaker is speaking from hearsay.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: infinitiveまたはkoḍiが直前に来て、「〜を思う」など主に思考にまつわるverb の意味上のaccusativeを表すのが普通である。

translations.title: vowel stem noun
forms: area (not as in "the area of a square")

contents.title: usage
contents.text: nominative nominative hemと使うとコピュラ（〜である）としてふるまい、future participle・past participleに後置することで完了表現を作る。コピュラ自身の命令形・past participleなどを作るためには、同義語の通常verb bhápúḷを用いる。

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: accúḷ is an act of producing words and alphabets by moving writing instruments. On the other hand, horúḷ focuses more on writing as a means of recording information, having the connotation of somewhat long, coherent writing.

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: While káṇám implies the notion of infinite eternity, bhákáṇa simply signifies that something always holds.

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: 名詞bhákáṇaは属格でしか使えないが、káṇámは全ての格で使える。また、káṇámはどちらかというと未来に無限に続くことを意図するのに対し、bhákáṇaは単に「常である」様を表す。

contents.title: usage
contents.text: For "they", that is, the plural for "he", kiṣlo is the right word to use; on the other hand, "those ones over there" or "men" is expressed by the regular plural form kízá.

contents.title: cognate(s)
contents.text:
(third person masculine singular, that one over there) 藍kisi,皇ki
(man, male) 牌ki1,藍uki,藍ki

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: lási is preferred over ásúka when denoting a single person.Note, however, that, unlike the English word "one", *lásizá cannot be used to mean two or more persons.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: In some dialects, this verb takes the accusative, not the instrumental.

translations.title: dynamic verb
forms: to use/utilize [accusative] for the purpose of [hína]

contents.title: cognate(s)
contents.text: relatively recent borrowing of 牌tak1,藍taku

contents.title: usage
contents.text: As can be seen from the Lin character, the primary meaning is the ink, not the inkstick.

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: "nautu" means "word"; "zepha" denotes "language", composed of many "nautu" and grammar. "bhátán zepha" is "bhátán language"; "bhátán nautu" is "bhátán words".

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: Used as the suppletive form for the non-conjugating verb "hem". Using bhápúḷ in the situation where hem suffices has the slight connotation of formality.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: From ko + (genitive suffix)-om. Must be followed by a noun.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: must be followed by a noun

contents.title: usage
contents.text: singulare tantum noun; even when semantically plural, singular declensions are always used.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Unlike 藍t'aitaiu, which is used solely to express sadness, deja can also be used for positive situations.

contents.title: cognate(s)
contents.text: Of uncertain origin. Folk etymology relates it to "bhá aṭam" (all gods).

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Denotes series of interconnected rings; it does not have the connotation/nuance of binding/shackles/constraint.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Since this word comes from zíghúḷ "to move steadily", zíghíṣ can refer to any kind of time-measuring device that has to do with steady motion, whether it is a table clock, a wristwatch, a sundial or an hourglass.

contents.title: usage
contents.text:
to say "somewhere under A", you use A's instrumental case followed by rúṣ.
ṣoyabhau rúṣán bhoṇau "a burrow under a wall"

contents.title: usage
contents.text:
Appears only after a genitive or an adjective. Singular nominative tends to appear as zero.
ko ámaom hem? Is this yours?
ámaom kele sujamúha? Do you use yours?

translations.title: dynamic verb
forms: 〜(accusative)（という平面）を横切って進む

contents.title: usage
contents.text: 狭い道のようなものを対象としては（道に沿った方向の移動でも道を横切る方向の移動でも）使うことができない。

translations.title: stative verb
forms: for [nominative] to be able to see/observe [accusative]

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: aḍuhazoúḷは「見るために目とか顔とかを動かし、その結果として見て、見終わって顔などを戻す」みたいな一連の動作を指す。okákúḷはもっと語義が広く、意図性の有無に関わらず目から情報が入っている状態を指す。

translations.title: instantaneous verb
forms: for [nominative] to think/feel that he/she/they himself/herself/themselves want [accusative]
(and the like; basically the instantaneous versions of the same verb)

translations.title: stative verb
forms: to want (someone) to do [infinitive that has the different subject from the main clause+ema]

contents.title: usage
contents.text: It is originally the same word as "rijz" (aspiration, wish), which is formed by appending the nominalization suffix #1 to "rijúḷ". However, it is spelled differently owing to the subtle difference in the meaning.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Usually takes an infinitive or [verb + nominalization suffix #4] as the subject.

contents.title: usage
contents.text:
「会議を開く」などの意味で用いることはできない。Since it is a transitive verb, it is inadequate to use námúḷ to describe, for example,  the flower bloom.
「塞がっていたものに孔ができて通れるようになる」が中心語義なので、扉や窓、傷口などに用いるのが第一義であり、覆いが取れて中にアクセスできるようになるということから「包み紙を開く」「本を開く」などにも用いることができる。

translations.title: stative verb
forms: for [nominative] to be able to do [accusative/infinitive+ema]
for [nominative] to be capable of doing [infinitive+ema]
for [nominative] to have the ability to do [infinitive+ema]
for [nominative] to be able to perform [accusative/infinitive+ema]

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Unlike cognates in 牌 or 藍, it does not have the nuance of resisting / giving a counterblow.

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: Denotes not "digit (characters used to describe numbers)" but "number (an abstract concept which is frequently represented using digits)". "Digit" is denoted by "bhájabáni".

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: Denotes not "number (an abstract concept which is frequently represented using digits)" but "digit (characters used to describe numbers)". "Number" is denoted by "bágha".

contents.title: usage
contents.text:
Attaches to the root of an intransitive verb and creates a causative, transitive verb.
Example: cákíkúḷ "to come, to visit" → cákíkaúḷ "to make [accusative] visit, to bring about [accusative]"

contents.title: usage
contents.text:
Attaches to the root of an intransitive verb and creates a causative, transitive verb.
Example: janúḷ "to arise, to become generated" → janáúḷ "to make/create [accusative] out of [oṣa]"

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Joke word, coined as the calque of "poisson d'avril".

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: "nautu" means "word"; "zepha" denotes "language", composed of many "nautu" and grammar. "bhátán zepha" is "bhátán language"; "bhátán nautu" is "bhátán words".

translations.title: stative verb
forms: for it to be permissible to do [infinitive]
for it to be possible to do [infinitive] based on circumstances
for there to be no problem doing [infinitive]

forms: contraction of vowel stem plural postpositional and hína

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Unlike in 牌, this phrase is not used for calling/addressing to someone, but used exclusively for greeting.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: バート語の文法上は終助詞として扱うが、実際にtの音で発音されるわけではなく、あくまで感嘆を表すための記号である。故に、ラテン字転写では感嘆符で転写するが、バート文字で書く場合には、単語tを書きその後ろにピリオドを打つ必要がある。

contents.title: usage
contents.text: the plural form of the consonant stem noun k. Since this is extremely confusing, I added this as an entry of this dictionary.

translations.title: consonant stem noun
forms: the phrase used to denote the phrase "ká" to mean the plural of "k"

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: Since the phrase "ká" can either be the third person feminine singular pronoun or the plural of "k" (thing), this phrase can be used to disambiguate them.

translations.title: vowel stem noun
forms: the phrase used to denote the phrase "ká" to mean the third person feminine singular pronoun

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: Since the phrase "ká" can either be the third person feminine singular pronoun or the plural of "k" (thing), this phrase can be used to disambiguate them.

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text:
名詞句「全ての時」はbhá káṇaと2単語で綴る。
名詞bhákáṇaは属格でしか使えないが、káṇámは全ての格で使える。また、káṇámはどちらかというと未来に無限に続くことを意図するのに対し、bhákáṇaは単に「常である」様を表す。

contents.title: difference between synonyms
contents.text: While káṇám implies the notion of infinite eternity, bhákáṇa simply signifies that something always holds.

forms: バート語の単語を繋ぐ上の線

contents.title: culture
contents.text: eはアイル語reae、パイグ語la1などと同根であるが、現在では単独では死語である。ただし、nautuhomá eの構成要素としては残っており、またaṭam_kádなどと異なり文法上の制約には反していないことから、この連語自体をnautuhomá eでくっつけてnautuhomá_eと書くことはない。

contents.title: culture
contents.text: The general term for the dialects in which the distinction between bh and w is not maintained. Many of such dialects lack the aspirates; the aspirates in the standard language have become fricatives, approximants, and so on.

contents.title: culture
contents.text: The general term for the dialects in which the distinction between bh and w is not maintained. Many of such dialects lack the aspirates; the aspirates in the standard language have become fricatives, approximants, and so on.

contents.text: Used as a stative verb; that is, "I have the plan to ~"

contents.title: usage
contents.text: nínaccúなどの語に痕跡的に残るだけであり、; it is currently not a productive suffix.

translations.title: stative verb
forms: for [nominative] to be a replacement of [accusative]
for [nominative] to be able to replace [accusative]

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Attaches to the root of both an intransitive verb and a transitive verb and creates a causative verb. If the original verb is intransitive, the agent (causee) is marked in the accusative case; if the original verb is transitive, the original object remains in the accusative case and the agent (causee) is marked in the instrumental.

contents.title: usage
contents.text: Attaches to the root of both an intransitive verb and a transitive verb and creates a causative verb. If the original verb is intransitive, the agent (causee) is marked in the accusative case; if the original verb is transitive, the original object remains in the accusative case and the agent (causee) is marked in the instrumental.

contents.title: culture
contents.text: 牌 hia1 + 牌 aik2 + 牌 a。パイグ語 aik2 と異なり、バート語kádには「光」の他にもkádúḷ「目立つ」の名詞化として「視線・注目」という意味がある。また、バート語では、「属格 + k」の主格が単体の属格で現れるため、属格接辞が結果として単立できるが、パイグ語ではこれは不可能であり、この位置のaは感嘆詞として解釈される。よってパイグ語 hia1 aik2 a. は「光りたいです。」という意味にしかならない、言うなれば「伐製牌語」である。hi- が x- で借用されているのは、ワート弁の影響である。

contents.title: 文化
contents.text: 「大移住」。「大退去」とも。バート人がグォン・アルト藩国を去らなくてはいけなくなった2000年の痛ましい事件とそれに次ぐ混乱を指す。単に「行く」の意味もあれば「(永久に)去る」の意味を持つbohúḷは（訳語が揺れるのはそのため）、心の故郷であるグォン・アルト藩国に帰れる見込みの乏しいバート人の思いをよく表現しているともいえよう。

contents.title: usage
contents.text: the contraction of the dependent noun "k" followed by the copula "hem".

translations.title: consonant stem noun
forms: the act of adding a case ending to a noun
the act of declining a noun

translations.title: instantaneous verb
forms: to add a case ending to the noun [accusative] to make it into the case [instrumental]
to decline a noun [accusative] to the [instrumental] case
